intro: Linosyris sonoriensis, commonly known as the Sonoran linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical pods that contain several seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by wind. Linosyris sonoriensis is well-suited to harsh, dry environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
